description: From Latin īnstinctus, past participle of īnstinguō (“to incite, to instigate”), from in (“in, on”) + stinguō (“to prick”).

adjectives.description: instinct (comparative more instinct, superlative most instinct)

examples: a noble performance, instinct with sound principle

entries.meaning: A natural or inherent impulse or behaviour.
examples: Many animals fear fire by instinct.

entries.meaning: An intuitive reaction not based on rational conscious thought.
examples: an instinct for order; to be modest by instinct
Debbie's instinct was to distrust John.
